info.description:
The app service implements all app functions for GroupAlarm

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->
info.title: groupalarm App API

get.description: Returns all devices for queried owner

parameters.description: requested owner by using his userID
parameters.name: owner_id

parameters.description: requesting organization, not required if user accesses his own resources
parameters.name: organization_id

items.description: Device is the definition of an app-running device configuration

active.description: Whether this device will be used for notifications or not.

id.description: This device's ID. Will be set by the service on creation.

name.description: User-wide unique name for this device (e.g. Apple iPhone XS).

os.description:
The device's OS (e.g. Android 9.0.1 / iOS 12).
You should at least include the "android" or "ios" keyword to allow a distinction between our push services.

ownerID.description: ID of the user this device is created for.

pushTokenDevelopment.description: Defines if the given push-token should be used in a development-environment or not (APNS only)

400.description: owner_id is missing or in wrong format

post.description: Create a device configuration for specific user, used by our iOS / Android app

schema.description: Device is the definition of an app-running device configuration

active.description: Whether this device will be used for notifications or not.

id.description: This device's ID. Will be set by the service on creation.

name.description: User-wide unique name for this device (e.g. Apple iPhone XS).

os.description:
The device's OS (e.g. Android 9.0.1 / iOS 12).
You should at least include the "android" or "ios" keyword to allow a distinction between our push services.

ownerID.description: ID of the user this device is created for.

pushTokenDevelopment.description: Defines if the given push-token should be used in a development-environment or not (APNS only)

400.description: device configuration payload is missing or in wrong format

get.description: Returns whether the given organization has disabled this way of alarming or not

200.description: whether this way of alarming is disabled or not

items.description: IsDisabled is the request and response of requests via the api

400.description: organization_id is missing or in wrong format

put.description: Sets whether the given organization has this way of alarming disabled or not

400.description: organization_id is missing or in wrong format

schema.description: IsDisabled is the request and response of requests via the api

parameters.description: answer given by the user (yes / no)
parameters.name: answer

400.description: token / answer not found or invalid

post.description: Sets a push's status to delivered

active.description: Whether this device will be used for notifications or not.

API_Token.description: To use this API, you need an API-Token from the RBAC settings of your GroupAlarm organization. Place the token inside the HTTP-Header `API-Token` for every request, otherwise the API will return an "401 Unauthorized" error for your request.
API_Token.name: API-TOKEN

Personal-Access-Token.description: To use this API, you need a Personal Access Token from your profile settings. Place the token inside the HTTP-Header `Personal-Access-Token` for every request, otherwise the API will return an "401 Unauthorized" error for your request.
Personal-Access-Token.name: Personal-Access-Token

DeviceService.description: DeviceService describes all methods used to manage iOS / Android devices

DisabledOrganizationsService.description: DisabledOrganizationsService describes all methods used to organizations which have disabled this kind of alarming

DispatchStatus.description: DispatchStatus describes the current status of a user

delay.description: configured delay in seconds, when escalation is used after the last one

wayofalarm.description: type of the alarming way e.g. email

EscalationConfiguration.description: Definition of an escalation configuration payload

delay.description: configured delay in seconds, when escalation is used after the last one

wayofalarm.description: type of the alarming way e.g. email

organizationID.description: organization id for editing escalation as an organization administrator

userID.description: assigned user for this escalation configuration for organization administrator editing

escalationTier.description: current escalation tier for this message beginning at 0

maxEscalationTier.description: max escalation tier for this message

EventCreationItem.description: EventCreationItem is used by the different services to create a new audit-log item

EventList.description: An EventList contains multiple EventListItems and a TotalEvents count used for pagination

items.description: An EventListItem is used as a single audit-log entry in an EventList

user.description: User is a basic copy of user-service's PublicUser

totalEvents.description: total amount of events inside the events array

ImportResult.description: ImportResult describes the result of an import

InvitationText.description: InvitationText contains all information about a custom invitation text

InvitationTextService.description: InvitationTextService provides all functions needed to manage an organization's invitation text

IsDisabled.description: IsDisabled is the request and response of requests via the api

MFABackupCodesResponse.description: MFABackupCodesResponse contains a list of one-time-use emergency backup codes

MFACreateResponse.description: MFACreateResponse contains all information for the user to add this account to his MFA app

MFAEnabledResponse.description: MFAEnabledResponse contains whether the user has MFA enabled or not

MFAService.description: MFAService defines all functions a multi-factor-authentication service has to implement
